ovdesc.p: The main parameter record which contains details relating to the Direct Debit system the record is configured for. It contains details such as the Clearing Account category, Suspense Account category & Standalone mandate category. It is also used to specify the number of days before the value date that the claim file is to be submitted/resubmitted; the number of days after which a file is moved to history; whether standalone mandates are allowed and the currencies and holiday regions to be checked.

One parameter record is used for each Direct Debit system or sub-system. Each can have their own set of records which configure the formats of the inward & outward claim files, reason codes and claim cycles. This may be where several sort codes are used in the same clearing system and which are submitted individually; or where claims are made in different currency systems.

desc.p: Defines the directory where the inward claim file received from clearing agency is available.

Currently the inward file location & file is given for information purpose and the local interface has to be written to create the DD.ITEM and Inward claim processing Accounting entries using the details given here.
Optional field.
Must be a type 1 or 19 file.

The status of the mandate which is sent to the Customer's Bank can be updated to AVILABLE (ie. "Ready for use") manually after receiving the confirmation or after the elapse of number of days as specified here.

Incase the status is not changed manually, after the lapse of the period specified here, during end of day process, the DD.DDI status is automatically changes to " AVAILABLE " from its old Status "ADVISED".
Optional field
Valid values - nnC/W ( ie. 02W or 02C where W/C means Working or Calendar days) or NULL
This field can have the value as YES or NO.

When processing an INTERNAL DD.ITEM on CLAIM date, if this is set to YES, INWARD DD.DDI and DD.ITEM will be created by the system automatically when processing an INTERNAL DD.ITEM on CLAIM date and if set to NO it will not be created.
System defaults it to NO.
If “YES” then the mandate (DD.DDI) should be created automatically from the inbound message and if set to “NO” then, the DD.DDI mandate should be created manually before inbound message received.
Validation rules:
Optional Input.
If it is not inputted then it will be defaulted to “NO”.

Here you can specify the Number of days before a value date of a claim, the outward claim file is to be generated.

This is the date on which file will be generated and as on this value date claim accounting entries are raised. Hence while giving the frequency date in MORTGAGE contract or DD.DDI application, claim date period has to be taken into account.

For example When this field is given as 02C (2 Calendar days) & System date is 01 Jan then all claim which have the value date between 01 Jan to 03 Jan are picked for file generation process on 01Jan with the Value date & file date as 03 Jan. The Claim Accounting entries are raised on the value date i.e. 03 Jan.
If this field is blank then it means that the outward file will be generated only on the respective value date.
Optional field
Valid values nnW/C (ie 02W or 02 C -where W-Working days & C-Calender days) or Null.

The format of the record id of the claim file. To generate the record name along with the processing date-specify the name suffixed with "<DATE>". For example: DDOUT<DATE> which will generate file DDOUT20030101; the record will be in the location specified in the OUTWARD.FILE.LOC field.
The claim file is generated using the format given in DD.OUT.FORMAT field.
Optional field.
Optional field. Becomes mandatory for EXTERNAL DD processing.
1-11 Alpha Numeric Character's
Specify when the Forward entries to be generated in case the scheduled date is a holiday.

When this field is set to "Yes" & Claim is scheduled on a holiday, in such case the file generation, claim accounting and cycling of frequency (For Standalone DDI's) is done on the previous working day before the scheduled date.
When this field is set to NULL, then the Claim entry, Claim accounting and cycling of frequency for Standalone DDI's is raised only on next working day incase the scheduled date is a holiday.
Hence based on the Clearing practice (to claim before or after the scheduled date) this field can be set.
Optional field
Valid values "Y" or Null.

Specify the format based on which the outward claim file to be generated. This is the link to the clearing system and based on the clearing system, the reason codes as applicable for various events like first claim after DDI lodgment, Direct Debit claim, return , reject etc are populated.

The currency of the Direct Debit system this parameter relates to. It can be set to any valid currency. This field enables the processing of mandates and accounts in the specified currencies.
3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS, or 1-3 numeric character Currency Code.
Mandatory field

Multi-value field associated with BUS.CENTRE

The number of days after which the DD.ITEM which is returned can be resubmitted & funds can be received automatically. In other words it is the value date on which the resubmitted DD item will be claimed through Clearing Agency.
In case this field is left null then during DD return processing the resubmit value date can be given manually in DD.RETURN Application.

Otherwise when the resubmit value date is not given, then based on the number of days specified here & days given in CLAIM.DATE.PRD, the resubmit value date is defaulted in DD.RETURN application automatically.

For example In this field 02C specified with system date-01 Jan and CLAIM.DATE.PRD is given as 02C. In such case when an item is returned on 01 Jan, the resubmit Value date is defaulted as 05 Jan.(ie 01 Jan + 02 C + 02C).
Optional field
Valid values nnW/c (ie. 02W or 02C where C-Calender days or W-Working days) or NULL

The DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER which is to be used to build the Account(s) related to the DD Module & also the Dept Code to be used in STMT.ENTRY.

The Account that is used for Claim Accounting is is based on the Currency, Account.Class and the Account.Officer given in this parameter. If a valid ACCOUNT is not available a system error message will be given as the Account is mandatory for correct operation of the Direct Debit system.

This field can have any one of the values SAO, SNP or SSS.
This MODE will be used in ACCOUNTING process, when CLAIM processing happens for an INTERNAL DD on CLAIM date.
System defaults it to SAO.
The usage of DD.DDI can be contract driven or standalone. The extra processing and fields used for standalone processing in DD.DDI are allowed according to this setting.
A value of Yes means that standalone processing can be used and key fields on the DD.DDI will be permitted and validated.
Optional field.
Valid values "Yes" or Null

The countries/regions whose calendars will be checked for holidays for the currencies associated. Where the direct debit system is based in another country/region then this field allows the holidays to be checked against their calendar in addition to the system holidays so claims can be sent in a timely manner.
2-4 type A (alphanumeric) characters
The code must have a valid entry on the REGION and HOLIDAY tables.
